content.raw:
> it really does not matter where it is just so long as it is consistent

I think you solved the mystery! :tada: The controller probably never knows that it has been translated, but as long as you give it offsets with respect to its current position, it will work.

> My worry is that these lookups are going to fail during the competition and the world frame is not going to be available

Together with @iche033 we launched a constellation on CloudSim and checked that the world frame is available from the field computer:

~~~
root@ip-172-31-23-39:/home/docker/ws#  rosrun tf tf_echo world pelvis
At time 59.388
- Translation: [0.079, 0.023, 0.993]
- Rotation: in Quaternion [-0.000, -0.000, -0.000, 1.000]
            in RPY (radian) [-0.000, -0.000, -0.000]
            in RPY (degree) [-0.000, -0.017, -0.004]
~~~

We also teleported the robot:

~~~
root@ip-172-31-23-39:/home/docker/ws# rosservice call /srcsim/finals/start_task 2 1
success: True
~~~

And checked that the orientation is updated on TF:

~~~
root@ip-172-31-23-39:/home/docker/ws# rosrun tf tf_echo world pelvis
At time 68.356
- Translation: [0.037, 0.067, 0.989]
- Rotation: in Quaternion [-0.000, -0.000, -0.381, 0.925]
            in RPY (radian) [-0.000, -0.000, -0.781]
            in RPY (degree) [-0.000, -0.016, -44.758]
~~~

We still need to check whether walking works, but no worries, the TF lookups using world frame are available.
